messages.message: A prospect <mailto:romain@dotfile.com|romain@dotfile.com> or <mailto:romain.minaud@gmail.com|romain.minaud@gmail.com> also just got back to me saying that he's unable to upload their french commercial registers into the platform. Any workaround?
Do we have any information on the type or size of files?
it looks like we are trying to fetch attachments for this PDF

Our default digitize would fail if extracting an attachment that satisfies allowed file types fail. Do we want to ignore that for aihub in general ? Dont think we process that extracted attachment anyways through queries as such for now.
it shouldn't fail the main file -- it should behave the same as how we treat email attachments
If we fail to extract attachments from file, think we still fail. But if we fail to process /digitize extracted attachment - we still pass main file. Need to check back on this one.
i see; i think overall failing the entire file because we can't read an attachement is too aggressive; let's log a warning message in the flow and still process the rest
is there anyway the customer can remove corrupted  attachments from a PDF? (like in Acrobat? somehow to unblock them)
Yes I see acrobat Pro / standard edition and some other PDF editors support that. Basic Reader does not have that functionality though.

let's make a task to handle this more robustly. @Nico -- the short answer is their pdf file has some corrupted attachment that we can't read. we will make a change to relax attachment handling here; meanwhile if they can use Acrobat to remove attachments from the PDF & re-upload the file we should be able to process it. I did a quick google and here's a video on how to do it https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=u_KiP519nc0
Thanks Kerry. @Nico do you have what you need to respond?
